trans-unit.source: Supportability and retirement policy guide for Azure Guest OS | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Supportability and retirement policy guide for Azure Guest OS | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Provides information about what Microsoft will support as regards to the Azure Guest OS used by Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: Provides information about what Microsoft will support as regards to the Azure Guest OS used by Cloud Services.

trans-unit.source: Azure Guest OS supportability and retirement policy
trans-unit.target: Azure Guest OS supportability and retirement policy

trans-unit.source: The information on this page relates to the Azure Guest operating system ([Guest OS](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff729422.aspx)) for Cloud Services worker and web roles (PaaS).
trans-unit.target: The information on this page relates to the Azure Guest operating system ([Guest OS](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff729422.aspx)) for Cloud Services worker and web roles (PaaS).

trans-unit.source: It does not apply to Virtual Machines (IaaS).
trans-unit.target: It does not apply to Virtual Machines (IaaS).

trans-unit.source: Microsoft has a published [support policy for the Guest OS](http://support.microsoft.com/gp/azure-cloud-lifecycle-faq).
trans-unit.target: Microsoft has a published [support policy for the Guest OS](http://support.microsoft.com/gp/azure-cloud-lifecycle-faq).

trans-unit.source: The page you are reading now describes how the policy is implemented.
trans-unit.target: The page you are reading now describes how the policy is implemented.

trans-unit.source: The policy is
trans-unit.target: The policy is

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will support **at least the latest two families of the Guest OS**.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will support **at least the latest two families of the Guest OS**.

trans-unit.source: When a family is retired, customers have 12 months from the official retirement date to update to a newer supported Guest OS family.
trans-unit.target: When a family is retired, customers have 12 months from the official retirement date to update to a newer supported Guest OS family.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will support the **at least the latest two versions of the supported Guest OS families**.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will support the **at least the latest two versions of the supported Guest OS families**.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will support the at **least the latest two versions of the Azure SDK**.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will support the at **least the latest two versions of the Azure SDK**.

trans-unit.source: When a version of the SDK is retired, customers will have 12 months from the official retirement date to update to a newer version.
trans-unit.target: When a version of the SDK is retired, customers will have 12 months from the official retirement date to update to a newer version.

trans-unit.source: At times more than two families or releases may be supported.
trans-unit.target: At times more than two families or releases may be supported.

trans-unit.source: Official Guest OS support information will appear on the [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).
trans-unit.target: Official Guest OS support information will appear on the [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).

trans-unit.source: When a Guest OS family or version is retired
trans-unit.target: When a Guest OS family or version is retired

trans-unit.source: A new Guest OS **family** is introduced sometime after the release of a new official version of the Windows Server operating system.
trans-unit.target: A new Guest OS **family** is introduced sometime after the release of a new official version of the Windows Server operating system.

trans-unit.source: Whenever a new Guest OS family is introduced, Microsoft will retire the oldest Guest OS family.
trans-unit.target: Whenever a new Guest OS family is introduced, Microsoft will retire the oldest Guest OS family.

trans-unit.source: New Guest OS **versions** are introduced about every month to incorporate the latest MSRC updates.
trans-unit.target: New Guest OS **versions** are introduced about every month to incorporate the latest MSRC updates.

trans-unit.source: Because of the regular monthly updates, a Guest OS version is normally disabled 60 days after its release.
trans-unit.target: Because of the regular monthly updates, a Guest OS version is normally disabled 60 days after its release.

trans-unit.source: This keeps at least two Guest OS versions for each family available for use.
trans-unit.target: This keeps at least two Guest OS versions for each family available for use.

trans-unit.source: Process during a Guest OS family retirement
trans-unit.target: Process during a Guest OS family retirement

trans-unit.source: Once the retirement is announced, customers have a 12 month "transition" period before the older family is officially removed from service.
trans-unit.target: Once the retirement is announced, customers have a 12 month "transition" period before the older family is officially removed from service.

trans-unit.source: This transition time may be extended at the discretion of Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: This transition time may be extended at the discretion of Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Updates will be posted on the [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).
trans-unit.target: Updates will be posted on the [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).

trans-unit.source: A gradual retirement process will begin 6 months into the transition period.
trans-unit.target: A gradual retirement process will begin 6 months into the transition period.

trans-unit.source: During this time:
trans-unit.target: During this time:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will notify customers of the retirement.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will notify customers of the retirement.

trans-unit.source: The newer version of the Azure SDK won’t support the retired Guest OS family.
trans-unit.target: The newer version of the Azure SDK won’t support the retired Guest OS family.

trans-unit.source: New deployments and redeployments of Cloud Services will not be allowed on the retired family
trans-unit.target: New deployments and redeployments of Cloud Services will not be allowed on the retired family

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will continue to introduce new Guest OS version incorporating the latest MSRC updates until the last day of the transition period, known as the "expiration date".
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will continue to introduce new Guest OS version incorporating the latest MSRC updates until the last day of the transition period, known as the "expiration date".

trans-unit.source: At that time, the any Cloud Services still running will be unsupported under the Azure SLA.
trans-unit.target: At that time, the any Cloud Services still running will be unsupported under the Azure SLA.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft has the discretion to force upgrade, delete or stop those services after that date.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft has the discretion to force upgrade, delete or stop those services after that date.

trans-unit.source: Process during a Guest OS Version retirement
trans-unit.target: Process during a Guest OS Version retirement

trans-unit.source: If customers set their Guest OS to automatically update, they never have to worry about dealing with Guest OS versions.
trans-unit.target: If customers set their Guest OS to automatically update, they never have to worry about dealing with Guest OS versions.

trans-unit.source: They will always be using the latest Guest OS version.
trans-unit.target: They will always be using the latest Guest OS version.

trans-unit.source: Guest OS Versions are released every month.
trans-unit.target: Guest OS Versions are released every month.

trans-unit.source: Because of the rate of regular releases, each version has a fixed lifespan.
trans-unit.target: Because of the rate of regular releases, each version has a fixed lifespan.

trans-unit.source: At 60 days into the lifespan a version is "*disabled*".
trans-unit.target: At 60 days into the lifespan a version is "*disabled*".

trans-unit.source: "Disabled" means that the version is removed from the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: "Disabled" means that the version is removed from the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: It also can no longer be set from the CSCFG configuration file.
trans-unit.target: It also can no longer be set from the CSCFG configuration file.

trans-unit.source: Existing deployments are left running, but new deployments and code and configuration updates to existing deployments will not be allowed.
trans-unit.target: Existing deployments are left running, but new deployments and code and configuration updates to existing deployments will not be allowed.

trans-unit.source: At a later time, the Guest OS version "*expires*" and any installations still running that version are force upgraded and set to automatically update the Guest OS in the future.
trans-unit.target: At a later time, the Guest OS version "*expires*" and any installations still running that version are force upgraded and set to automatically update the Guest OS in the future.

trans-unit.source: Expiration is done in batches so the period of time from disablement to expiration can vary.
trans-unit.target: Expiration is done in batches so the period of time from disablement to expiration can vary.

trans-unit.source: These periods may be made longer at Microsoft's discretion to ease customer transitions.
trans-unit.target: These periods may be made longer at Microsoft's discretion to ease customer transitions.

trans-unit.source: Any changes will be communicated on the [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).
trans-unit.target: Any changes will be communicated on the [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).

trans-unit.source: Notifications during retirement
trans-unit.target: Notifications during retirement

trans-unit.source: **Family retirement**
trans-unit.target: **Family retirement**

trans-unit.source: Microsoft will use blog posts and management portal notification.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft will use blog posts and management portal notification.

trans-unit.source: Customers who are still using a retired Guest OS family will be notified through direct communication (email, portal messages, phone call) to assigned service administrators.
trans-unit.target: Customers who are still using a retired Guest OS family will be notified through direct communication (email, portal messages, phone call) to assigned service administrators.

trans-unit.source: All changes will be posted to this page and the RSS feed listed at the beginning of this page.
trans-unit.target: All changes will be posted to this page and the RSS feed listed at the beginning of this page.

trans-unit.source: **Version Retirement**
trans-unit.target: **Version Retirement**

trans-unit.source: All changes will be posted to this page and the RSS feed listed at the beginning of this page, including the release, disabled and expiration dates.
trans-unit.target: All changes will be posted to this page and the RSS feed listed at the beginning of this page, including the release, disabled and expiration dates.

trans-unit.source: Services admins will receive emails if they have deployments running on a disabled Guest OS version or family.
trans-unit.target: Services admins will receive emails if they have deployments running on a disabled Guest OS version or family.

trans-unit.source: The timing of these emails can vary.
trans-unit.target: The timing of these emails can vary.

trans-unit.source: Generally they are at least a month before disablement, though this timing is not an official SLA.
trans-unit.target: Generally they are at least a month before disablement, though this timing is not an official SLA.

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions

trans-unit.source: How can I mitigate the impacts of migration?
trans-unit.target: How can I mitigate the impacts of migration?

trans-unit.source: You should use latest Guest OS family for designing your Cloud Services.
trans-unit.target: You should use latest Guest OS family for designing your Cloud Services.

trans-unit.source: Start planning your migration to a newer family early.
trans-unit.target: Start planning your migration to a newer family early.

trans-unit.source: Set up temporary test deployments to test your Cloud Service running on the new family.
trans-unit.target: Set up temporary test deployments to test your Cloud Service running on the new family.

trans-unit.source: [Set your Guest OS version](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg433101.aspx) to "Automatic" (osVersion=* in the [.CSCFG](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg456324.aspx) file) so the migration to new Guest OS versions occurs automatically.
trans-unit.target: [Set your Guest OS version](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg433101.aspx) to "Automatic" (osVersion=* in the [.CSCFG](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/gg456324.aspx) file) so the migration to new Guest OS versions occurs automatically.

trans-unit.source: What if my web application requires deeper integration with the OS?
trans-unit.target: What if my web application requires deeper integration with the OS?

trans-unit.source: If your web application architecture requires deeper dependency on the underlying operating system, use platform supported capabilities such as "[Startup Tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg456327.aspx)" or other extensibility mechanisms which may exist in the future.
trans-unit.target: If your web application architecture requires deeper dependency on the underlying operating system, use platform supported capabilities such as "[Startup Tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg456327.aspx)" or other extensibility mechanisms which may exist in the future.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can also use [Azure Virtual Machines](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/scenarios/virtual-machines/) (IaaS – Infrastructure as a Service), where you are responsible for maintaining the underlying operating system.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can also use [Azure Virtual Machines](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/scenarios/virtual-machines/) (IaaS – Infrastructure as a Service), where you are responsible for maintaining the underlying operating system.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Review the latest [Guest OS releases](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).
trans-unit.target: Review the latest [Guest OS releases](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
